detaileddescription.para: This method must be implemented in derived classes. An instance of Observer does not call this method directly: instead, it will be called by the observables the instance registered with when they need to notify any changes.
This method must implement any calculations which must be (re)done in order to calculate the desired results.

briefdescription.para: the latest date for which the curve can return values

memberdef.argsstring: (Natural settlementDays, const Calendar &cal, BusinessDayConvention bdc, const DayCounter &dc, const Period &lag, Frequency frequency, bool indexIsInterpolated, Rate minStrike, Rate maxStrike, Volatility baseYoYVolatility, std::vector< ext::shared_ptr< typename Traits::helper > > instruments, Real accuracy=1.0e-12, const Interpolator &interpolator=Interpolator())

briefdescription.para: Piecewise year-on-year inflation volatility term structure.

detaileddescription.para: We use a flat smile for bootstrapping at constant K. Happily most of the work has already been done in the bootstrapping classes. We only need to add special attention for the start where there is usually no data, only assumptions.
